name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
A brief discussion
I was watching "The Wandering Earth 2". To be honest, I didn't expect the special effects to be so amazing.
I think it's fine as a commercial movie, because the movie itself doesn't have any in-depth discussion, neither about digital life nor about randomly selecting and abandoning 3.5 billion people.
In fact, the real main plot of the movie is that artificial intelligence attempts to destroy humanity, but there is no discussion about the ethics of artificial intelligence. 1/n

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: That’s right, for those who haven’t read the original novel, the core plot of this movie is actually a very standard popcorn movie: a scientist misses his daughter so much that he uploads her consciousness into an artificial intelligence. In the end, the artificial intelligence wakes up and thinks the best way to protect humans is to kill everyone, so it attempts to use the moon to hit the earth. Then humans unite and finally blow up the moon, causing the earth to start wandering. 2/n

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
But it is also a very non-standard popcorn movie, without personal heroism, no troublesome villains and paranoid superiors, everything goes smoothly under the arrangement of the old leader, so that the process of saving the earth seems very boring

In fact, this story contains too many things to discuss, such as the struggle of human nature in the doomsday, the advantages and disadvantages and conflicts between digital life and real life, and whether human destiny can be determined by drawing lots3/n

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: But all the above content is just a passing scene in the movie, without any deep exploration of any issues. The story is about things happening, individual sacrifices, and final victory. You can't see any deeper ideological core that the director wants to express in it - perhaps for the adapted movie, this is good, because fans just want to see the scenes described in the book appear on the screen. 4/n

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: After a space battle that lasted about half an hour and had almost no effect on the plot, the movie began a long double plot. As I said before, the protagonist of this movie is actually the scientist played by Andy Lau, and Wu Jing's role is more like a supplement to the content of the first part. I personally think that if Wu Jing's role is removed, the movie will actually be a more coherent story. 5/n

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
I believe this movie is very ambitious, because its special effects are indeed of a very high level, and the portrayal of the entire world view is very realistic.
However, the film industry is just a shell. Whether it can gain widespread recognition in the world is actually a question of value output.
The film constantly emphasizes that the world should unite, but I doubt whether Chinese audiences who have been baptized by populist education will believe this. 6/n

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
We can see a lot of lines in the film that deliberately provoke national sentiment. The constant portrayal of foreigners denying China, belittling China, and finally being slapped in the face by China is actually the 21st century version of the "Sick Man of East Asia" plot.
Whether the "world peace and unity" that the film hopes to call for based on this plot is meaningful and convincing is actually a mystery. 7/n

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
To sum up, my evaluation of "The Wandering Earth 2" is that it is a nationalist commercial blockbuster wrapped in the cloak of world unity.
Its special effects are cool to watch, and the actors' acting skills are also online. It is a standard New Year's popcorn movie, that's all.
There is nothing particularly disliked about it, but if you haven't read the original work, it is indeed telling a very ordinary story with very gorgeous special effects. 8/n

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
In addition, I know that many book fans will disagree, but please note that too many book fans put their feelings for the book into the film and television works, but from the perspective of the viewer, I feel that the story of this movie did not attract me because it did not discuss the depth - it is the movie that does not have it, not the book, I hope you can understand the difference between the two.
9/n

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Finally, because the movie is not available in my area and is unlikely to be released in the short term, I found the resources on the Internet. The reason I watched it was to learn about this controversial movie as soon as possible and join the discussion. I apologize to the film's creators here. I personally oppose all acts of stealing and pirating. I bought a movie ticket here as a support. I hope that domestic films will get better and better.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
One more thing to add
There is a reason why this movie is so popular in China, because it is a science fiction blockbuster with world-class special effects, written, directed and performed by Chinese people, and the story is about Chinese people saving the world
It is a New Year blockbuster with all the attributes. I believe the box office of this movie will definitely go up to 6 billion.
The only regret is that the main creative team is too honest and did not learn from Changjin Lake to make two parts and win twice.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Also, don't worry, my personal information on my domestic account has long been stripped away. I am now naked inside the Great Firewall, so it doesn't matter whether it is leaked or not.

name: 李老师不是你老师
李老师不是你老师
content: In fact, "The Wandering Earth 2" was also born at an untimely time. Its hidden plot actually fits two major events in 2022: the Russian-Ukrainian war and China's insistence on dynamic zeroing. If Russia had not fallen into the quagmire and China was still zeroing out, then the stubborn and independent China in the movie and its close relationship with Russia would have become the best reality correspondence, and the topic would have been really successful. As a result, it was born at an untimely time, and the touching effect became a comedy effect.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @Milk12181218 I was too lazy to watch it, but I saw all kinds of discussions on Twitter and Weibo saying that this movie is "full of lies" so I went to watch it. In the end, I was quite disappointed, because the content is actually quite empty. Whether it is the humanistic thinking extended from the plot, or the further derivation of ideology, or even the connotation of lying bandits, there is actually not much involved. It is essentially a very empty popcorn movie, that's all.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Recently, in Zhumadian, Henan, an 18-year-old girl was kicked out of the house by her grandmother and forced to sleep with the dog because she refused to go on a blind date.
Ms. Zhang, the person involved, said that she had dropped out of school and started working very early, and many of her peers in her hometown already had children. She was quite resistant to blind dates, so her grandmother drove her out in a rage and did not allow her to sleep in the house. She slept outside for about 20 minutes that day, and was still driven out on the 24th to sleep with the dog.
